questions.question: The United Nations Convention Against Torture defines torture as:
options: Physical and mental pain inflicted upon a person for political purposes
The infliction of severe physical or mental pain or suffering for a particular purpose
Intense physical pain and violation of human rights
The systematic, intentional infliction of physical or psychological suffering
questions.answer: The infliction of severe physical or mental pain or suffering for a particular purpose

questions.question: Which country was the first to ratify the United Nations Convention Against Torture?
What is the name of the International Day in Support of Victims of Torture?
options: International Day for the Abolition of Slavery
International Day in Support of Victims of Torture
questions.answer: International Day in Support of Victims of Torture

questions.question: Which organization is dedicated to the global eradication of torture?
Which United Nations body is responsible for monitoring torture worldwide?
options: United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime
